Professional JS for Developers

This is a project I have put together from the book Professional JS for Developers by Nicholas C Zakas

See One, Do One, Teach One

Data Types - There are 5, maybe 6

  • Undefined - variable declared but not initialized!
  • Null - empty object pointer
  • Boolean - only two values true or false
  • Number - integers and floating point values
  • String - sequence of 0 or more 16-unicode characters
  • Object - groups of data and functionality
var message = "some string";
console.log(typeof (message)); //object

String Character Literals

  • \n - new line
  • \t - tab
  • \b - backspace
  • \r - carriage return
  • \f - form feed
  • \\ - backslash
  • \' - single quote
  • \" - double quotes

Converting values to String

var num =10;
console.log(toString(num));

Object properties and methods

  • Constructor - function that was used to create the object
  • hasOwnProperty(property name) - indicates whether or not object exists on instance
  • isPrototypeOf(object) - indicates whether or not object is a prototype of another object
  • propertyIsEnumerable(property name) - indicates whether the object can be enumerated with for-in statement
  • toLocaleString() - returns string representation of the object appropriate for locale environment
  • toString() - returns string representation of object
  • valueOf() - returns string, number or boolean of object
Top

Arguments are values or valuables that are passed in functions
